intro: Microseris leptosepala, commonly known as the slender-sepaled microseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellow flowers arranged in a single terminal cluster. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments. Microseris leptosepala is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
